title: After 25 years of The Sims, could InZoi be about to steal its crown?
description: You know how the old saying goes: you wait 25 years for a The Sims competitor and then three come along at once. Lo-fi delight Tiny Life is already out in early access, and cosy contender Paralives arrives later this year. But first, there's South Korean development giant Krafton's InZoi - an ultra-slick, mega-budget spin on the classic life sim formula that mostly seems to be selling itself on its seamless worlds and glossy, photorealistic looks - but is that enough to usurp the genre king? Based on a half dozen hours or so with the game, I'm not so sure. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Split Fiction players invited to see studio's next game after beating rock-hard secret level
description: Split Fiction studio Hazelight has invited two players to Sweden to see its next game after they completed a secret level so challenging, "there are barely people on our team that can make it." Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: How To Customize Clothes And Furniture In InZoi
description: InZoi, Krafton's life simulator that could serve as the first real competition for The Sims, is finally arriving in early access on March 27, but the party is starting a little bit early with the launch of inZoi Creative Studio, which allows players to try out the game's character creation and build mode tools in-depth before jumping into this new simulated world.While many aspects of inZoi will be very familiar to fans of The Sims, particularly as they design their characters, or "Zois." But inZoi goes much further than The Sims in terms of how much you can customize your belongings, and it can be relatively easy to miss some of those options when you're trying the game out for the first time.There are two specific features we're going to highlight here: that you can craft your own clothing and furniture, and that you can apply your own custom textures and patterns to nearly anything. Essentially, these are mod tools built directly into the game's interface, with inZoi natively providing the means to create your own custom content.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Where To Find Ise Sadatame And The Messenger In Assassin's Creed Shadows
description: Wondering about where to find Ise Sadatame and the messenger in Assassin's Creed Shadows? These objectives are part of a larger quest where you need to locate another member of the Shinbakufu group, an arc that will take you all the way to Kyoto. Our guide has all the tips that you need for this portion of the campaign.Table of Contents [hide]Where to find Ise Sadatame and the messenger in Assassin's Creed Shadows - The Fool guideIse Sadatame's locationWhere to find Ise Sadatame and the messenger in Assassin's Creed Shadows - The Fool guideBoth Ise Sadatame and the messenger are part of a longer arc where you need to hunt down the Fool, one of the villains who's also a member of the Shinbakufu. The NPCs that you have to meet are in the outskirts of Kyoto, albeit in opposite directions. You can see where they're located in the map below:Ise Sadatame is southeast of Kyoto, while the messenger is to the west.Ise Sadatame's locationThe first order of business is to find Ise Sadatame. He's in an area called Ogura Pond, which is southeast of Kyoto. Once you've tagged the Ogura Pond fast travel point, head north to Byodoin Temple and have a chat with Sadatame.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Shield-slinging open worlder The Knightling goes all Jak & Captain America in August
description: Remember how it felt in Bloodborne when you discovered a shield and learned that it existed purely to shame and humiliate returning Dark Souls players who are over-reliant on blocking? Do you remember reading those awful, judging, fourth-wall-besmirching words, ‚ÄúShields are nice, but not if they engender passivity‚Äù? Well, The Knightling is the opposite of that feeling. It‚Äôs a bouncy, breezy open world platformer in which you are a novice chevalier equipped with a circular, gear-toothed shield he uses for absolutely everything. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 871
description: So‚Ä¶what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn‚Äôt, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It‚Äôs just a list of more or less random questions I‚Äôve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What eye makeup products have been on repeat with you lately? Maybelline Lash Sensational Sky High Mascara (eh, it‚Äôs just OK), Stila Liquid Liner Micro Tip (it‚Äôs pretty good) and good ol‚Äô Anastasia Brow Pencil. 2. How good are you about finding clothes that fit you well? I used to be OK at it, but now, I don‚Äôt really enjoy in-person shopping as much as I used to, so I don‚Äôt spend the time that one really needs to find the things that fit great. There‚Äôs always something a little off with my clothes and I just kinda live with it. Blergh! On the bright side, at least my outfit is always ironed and somewhat matching. 3. How good are you about resisting impulse purchases? Pretty good![Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 871 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 854
description: Tabs was a natural born optimist. He always saw the up side to everything, sought out the silver linings and took advantage of every opportunity to spread hope and joy. That might be why he liked holidays so much ‚Äî because they were an opportunity to play Santa ‚ÄúClaws,‚Äù so to speak, and spread good tidings to everyone. Perhaps for the obvious reasons, St. Patrick‚Äôs Day was a fave. Obviously, with those gorgeous green eyes, he loved the color scheme. ‚òòÔ∏è And then, of course, the gold‚Ä¶ He was also a big fan of that. üòä Rosie has her own reasons for celebrating St. Paddy‚Äôs Day. For starter‚Äôs, alchemy‚Ä¶ In fact, she did her PhD dissertation in turning lead into gold through targeted meows in the ultra-low frequency range, the so-called ‚Äúsmoker‚Äôs meow‚Äù spectrum. Marnie, however, did not get the memo regarding St. Patrick‚Äôs Day this year. Or rather, she did get the memo, but she didn‚Äôt read it. Or, well, she read it‚Ä¶ She just didn‚Äôt understand it at all. üòπ Your friendly neighborhood[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 854 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
